body_html:
The docstring has been updated, and I have added some more tests.

Following this PR, I think the outstanding differences from numpy will be that:

  • Ellipses will not be recognized. This shouldn't be too hard to implement, but I don't know that I have the bandwidth to get it done in the near future.
  • Subscripts where an axis appears more than once (example: ii->i computes the trace of a matrix). Adding support for this seems a little bit more involved.

Exceptions are raised for both of these cases.

Subscripts where an axis appears more than once (example: ii->i computes the trace of a matrix). Adding support for this seems a little bit more involved.

Exceptions are raised for both of these cases.
body:
The docstring has been updated, and I have added some more tests.

Following this PR, I think the outstanding differences from numpy will be that:
- Ellipses will not be recognized. This shouldn't be too hard to implement, but I don't know that I have the bandwidth to get it done in the near future.
- Subscripts where an axis appears more than once (example: `ii->i` computes the trace of a matrix). Adding support for this seems a little bit more involved.

Exceptions are raised for both of these cases.
